Use this data source to access an ID for your MPA Account billing scope.


{{% examples %}}

## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}





{{< example csharp >}}

```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Azure = Pulumi.Azure;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var example = Output.Create(Azure.Billing.GetMpaAccountScope.InvokeAsync(new Azure.Billing.GetMpaAccountScopeArgs
        {
            BillingAccountName = "e879cf0f-2b4d-5431-109a-f72fc9868693:024cabf4-7321-4cf9-be59-df0c77ca51de_2019-05-31",
            CustomerName = "2281f543-7321-4cf9-1e23-edb4Oc31a31c",
        }));
        this.Id = example.Apply(example => example.Id);
    }

    [Output("id")]
    public Output<string> Id { get; set; }
}
```

```go
package main

	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure/sdk/v4/go/azure/billing"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		example, err := billing.GetMpaAccountScope(ctx, &billing.GetMpaAccountScopeArgs{
			BillingAccountName: "e879cf0f-2b4d-5431-109a-f72fc9868693:024cabf4-7321-4cf9-be59-df0c77ca51de_2019-05-31",
			CustomerName:       "2281f543-7321-4cf9-1e23-edb4Oc31a31c",
		}, nil)
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		ctx.Export("id", example.Id)
		return nil
	})
}
```
